description: Dive into "Naples' Coastal Escapes: Sun-Kissed Shores" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Naples' Coastal Escapes: Sun-Kissed Shores

places.generalDescription: Spiaggia della Gaiola is a stunning public beach located in Naples, within the marine protected area of Parco Sommerso della Gaiola. The beach offers wonderfully clear waters and breathtaking views of Vesuvius and the Gulf of Naples. With limited capacity to protect marine flora and fauna, visitors need to reserve their spot online in advance. The beach is divided into morning and afternoon shifts, each allowing 75 people with restrictions on motorboats and fishing.

sources.snippet: The beach, located inside the park of the same name, allows you to resurface the ancient Greek and Roman culture. More precisely, it is a marine area located in the coastal stretch of Posillipo where, for those who wish, there is the possibility of practicing underwater activities and organized kayak tours.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Naples and its province, how to get there and book

sources.snippet: We highly advise you to visit this place in your stay in Naples, due is a restricted area, they don‚Äôt allow many people to get in. Wake up early in order to don‚Äôt be disappointed. The Gaiola beach is situated in the Gulf of Naples just below the Posillipo Borough, one of the cosiest and fancy of Naples.
sources.shortName: Exploring The 13 Best Beaches In Naples Italy; A Local Guide

places.name: Gaiola Beach

reviews.text: If you can book, don't hesitate to! Cleanest beach and bluest water! We were so lucky to find two available spots! There were only locals around. The only bad thing is getting there. 30 minutes till the beach and 30 minutes back, walk.

Beautiful beach reserve. You need to book tickets in advance but they are free. The water is really clean and you are not supposed to enter with any plastics, glass etc. The views were beautiful and the water was clean and clear. Decent walk to get to the beach but worth it in my opinion. Really loved it

The walk to the beach is roughly 30 minutes but it is worth it. Please do not follow Google map as you will end up on a private road with no access to the beach. When you see the private road signs to your left (as per picture bellow) keep the right and keep walking down the main road.

places.generalDescription: Marechiaro is a charming ancient fishing village in Naples, known for inspiring the famous song "Marechiare." The small window overlooking the sea, called 'A Fenestella di Marechiaro,' evokes thoughts and dreams of love. Despite its elegant fish restaurants, Marechiaro maintains an atmosphere of simplicity. One standout dining spot is "A Fenestella," offering excellent cuisine and boasting a terrace with an enchanting view of the sea.

sources.snippet: While in this region, temperatures are around 30 degrees in summer, there are unfortunately few beaches around Naples, most of them are private and paying (count about 15‚Ç¨ per day to access them). We have selected the 6 most beautiful beaches near Naples, most of which are public and free.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Naples not to be missed in 2024

places.name: Panoramic view of Marechiaro

reviews.text: Beautiful sight. Be warned that the trek down and up to the main street is not an easy one.

Great place to spend the day with an out of the ordinary scene. The beach can be crowded so you can take a boat(5‚Ç¨) that'll get you to the other side and you can find a less crowded spot. I highly recommend it if you're looking for clean Waters and surrounded by nature.

Amazing view.
Tip: bring your own pack lunch (unless you want to go for an expensive meal).
Where most coffee are about ‚Ç¨1 mark, here they go for UK prices.
It is an exclusive place after all

places.generalDescription: Gaiola Island is a small island located in a protected marine area near Naples. It features an abandoned villa that locals believe to be cursed, adding to its mysterious allure. Accessing the island involves a challenging descent through ancient Neapolitan houses, but the effort is said to be worth it. The island offers a spectacular beach and a submerged park, making it an unforgettable destination for swimming and exploration. However, visitors should be prepared for the strenuous climb back up from the island.

sources.snippet: This very small free beach is located inside the Submerged Park of Gaiola, a wonderful protected marine reserve that has an impressive cliff and two small islands connected to each other thanks to the presence of an artificial bridge. The surroundings are also characterized by the presence of the suggestive village of Marechiaro, among the most enchanting places that can be visited during a holiday in Napoli. You can safely count Gaiola at the top of the list of the most beautiful beaches near Napoli, not only for the spectacular panorama that bathers can admire but also because protected animal and plant species also live in the waters of the site.
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches near Napoli

sources.snippet: Almost at the top of Via Posillipo, near Parco Virgiliano, there is a steep descent that leads down to Gaiola Underwater Park, a protected marine zone that stretches 41.6 hectares, from the village of Marechiaro to the beautiful Trentaremi Bay. Take the plunge and discover underwater shipwrecks. Gaiola is one of the smallest islands in Naples.
sources.shortName: Unmissable beaches around Naples - VOLARE MAGAZINE

sources.snippet: Gaiola is one of the best beaches close to Naples Italy, and one of the calmest ones. If you travel, you will want to go to the best sandy beaches near Naples Italy, and La Gaiola is it. Located in Posillipo in a marine reserve just a stone‚Äôs throw away from the city, it was once the port area of an immense Roman villa.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches Around Naples, Italy

places.name: Gaiola Island

reviews.text: Spectacular beach, as well as a submerged park, the Gaiola is a place not to be missed, despite the effort to arrive thanks to a beautiful descent that turns into a strenuous climb to do on foot ...To be seen early in the morning for the line only the first 100 can enter carry shoes and spirit of adaptation mine lasted about 1.30

I expected something special. After a 10 minutes walk down from the parking, there was a tiny beach and an uninforming information center. The islands themselves are closed for visitors. One can see the Islands and the connecting bridge from about 50 distance. The areas of special interest for snorkeling with sunken villas are inside the protection area A - not allowed to enter. When I was snorkeling the sight was maybe 2-3 meters in an area of 100 m from the beach. Quite some fish up to 30 cm, nothing special. Maybe I should have snorkeled farther out. I think there are many other interesting beaches around.
Fantastic and magic place üëçüëçüëçüëç

places.generalDescription: Baia Trentaremi is a popular bay lookout known for its breathtaking panoramic views of the ocean, cliffs, and sunset. It can be reached by paddling from Gaiola, offering a beautiful beach experience. However, it's important to note that the area is unfortunately affected by plastic and construction waste. The beach can be accessed from Cordoglio in about 40 minutes of calm swimming or by kayak for a more peaceful journey.

sources.snippet: This little creek into the beautiful area of Pausilypon Archeological Park is one of the gems of our list of best beaches in Naples Italy. This place is really down the cliff and reachable just from the sea. The Bay of Trentaremi is definitely one of the most enchanting and suggestive places in the Gulf of Naples.
sources.shortName: Exploring The 13 Best Beaches In Naples Italy; A Local Guide
13 Best Beaches In Naples, Italy [Napoli]

places.name: Baia Trentaremi

reviews.text: Bell
If you hope, that you will rent a kayak and will have a stop here, unfortunately the beach will welcome you full of rubbish left there. Stones are mixed with parts of bottles and the rest of tiles.
Before you come to this beach you have to registrate.

places.address: Via Tito Lucrezio Caro, 22, 80123 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Riva Fiorita is a stunning and lively beach near Naples, Italy, offering free access to one of the best sandy beaches in the area. Located in Posillipo, it features a small promenade surrounded by rocks that serve as perfect diving spots into the blue sea. This magical place has also been featured as the set of Palazzo Palladini for fans of 'Un Posto al Sole.'

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for the most beautiful beaches close to Naples Italy, you will be happy to discover Riva Fiorita. This is one of the most beautiful and lively beaches around Naples, and it promises lots of fun times whether you‚Äôre going solo, with friends, or with family. One of the best sandy beaches near Naples Italy, Riva Fiorita is a beach with free access.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches Around Naples, Italy

sources.snippet: Riva Fiorita is another wonderful Posillipo beach, a short distance from the stretch where Villa Volpicelli is located. Here there is a small promenade, surrounded by a belt of rocks, which represent the perfect springboard for diving into the blue sea.
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches near Napoli

places.name: Riva Fiorita

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Small beach adjacent to Villa Volpicelli
Historic palace in Naples famous for being Palazzo Palladini of a place in the sun. The beach has fine sand but the portion is really narrow, there is space on the rocks, it is possible to take sunbeds and rent kayaks. There is a bar and restaurant nearby

(Original)
Piccola spiaggetta adiacente a Villa Volpicelli
Palazzo storico di Napoli famoso per essere palazzo Palladini di un posto al sole. La spiaggia ha sabbia fine ma la porzione √® proprio stretta c'√® spazio sugli scogli, possibile prendere dei lettini e noleggiare kayak. C'√® un bar e un ristorante vicino

(Translated by Google) A magical, wonderful place. For all lovers of Un Posto al Sole here is the set of Palazzo Palladini. If you come to Naples visit Vadoanapoli.it for other itineraries, B&Bs, Restaurants, on the City of Naples. Follow us on Facebook vagoanapoli

places.address: Via Ferdinando Russo, 21, 80123 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Baia delle Rocce Verdi, named after the emerald submerged rocks along the coast, is a popular beach club in Napoli known for its picturesque views of the bay. Located on the rocky Posillipo coast, it offers saltwater pools overlooking the Bay of Naples and stunning vistas of Capri and the Sorrento peninsula. The beach almost feels like a hidden gem with its beautiful green rocks lining the coast.

sources.snippet: When the sun shines on the submerged rocks at this stunning beach along the Posillipo coast, on the northwestern edge of the Bay of Naples, they take on a green hue, hence this beloved beach's name, Green Rocks. Though you'll have to pay an entry fee, Rocce Verdi has a lot of perks. Catch some rays on a comfortable sunbed situated on the rocky coast, or head to the top of the beach's anterior cliff, where you can dive into one of the two large saltwater pools overlooking the bay.
sources.shortName: 6 of the best beaches in Naples

sources.snippet: Named after the emerald submerged rocks along the coast, Rocce Verdi is one of the best beaches in Napoli for cliff diving. Located on the rocky, Posillipo coast, Rocce Verdi has two saltwater pools that overlook the Bay of Naples, giving you an absolutely beautiful view of the island of Capri as well as the Sorrento peninsula.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches In Naples, Italy [Napoli]

sources.snippet: The Rocce Verdi Naples beach is located on the Positano coast, and it almost feels secret. The name ‚Äúgreen rocks‚Äù given to the beach reminds you of the rocks that line the coast. The play-on-light between the sun and the waters give various hues of green to the big rocks from which you only want to jump.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches Around Naples, Italy

sources.snippet: One of the most beautiful places in Posillipo is the Rocce Verdi bay, from where you can admire Capri Island and the Gulf of Naples. Here the wonderful Villa Fattorusso is located: a beach resort that offers two swimming pools, a restaurant, and a rooftop garden.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches In Naples and surroundings

places.name: Baia delle Rocce Verdi

reviews.text: We were there on a saturday and we had space, the workers were authentic and the view was wonderful. Price was 25 ‚Ç¨ per person included the sun lounger. There was also a bistro with drinks and snacks. Highly recommend!

Nothing to rave about except you have the option of the sea or a pool. Entry is ‚Ç¨25 with a sun lounger, but an extra ‚Ç¨5 for a towel. You need a swim cap for the pool, which you can get from them for ‚Ç¨2. The seaside is rocky but with ample space & different areas for swimming. The rocks are slippery & there's no sand - not idea for someone who doesn't know how to swim. They have food & drinks (both alcoholic & none) but overpriced. The food should only be viewed as a necessity to keep yourself full should you stay the day - otherwise bland & not up to expectations. They start ushering you out at 4:30PM, with complete closure at 5PM as the venue also doubles as an event space. It's a beautiful setting but if you know of something better/you're comfortable with... go there instead.

We had a great time here. It was 40 euros but across the sea at amalfi they can be 600. The entrance fee keeps away people you don't want lurking around. We got there around 10 and it wasn't crowded, at 12 a lot more people were there but mainly just to sun bathe the water was never crowded. The staff was friendly. From the club house the coast is stone, but once your in the water there is a little sand bar you can swim too. We paid the fee and selected the sea rather than the pool, when we got to the sea area a staff dude grabbed us some cots and found a spot for us. Bathrooms, showers, changing rooms there. You need to bring a towel, rent one or air dry. We grabbed lunch up at the club house, spent 10 euros on a chicken sandwich with fries a water and a coke. Just decent pool food with decent prices. It's a long walk down, be prepared for a trek back up or hire a taxi. We're in decent shape and needed a couple breaks on our way up.

places.address: Via Posillipo, 68 mare, 80123 Napoli NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: This 19th century bathhouse with a sandy beach is a scenic setting for weddings & special events.

sources.snippet: The private beach Bagno Elena boasts a splendid location in the Bay of Naples, adjacent to the 17th-century palace Palazzo Donn'Anna in Posillipo. Bathers have been catching rays and swimming the deep blue Mediterranean Sea here since it opened in 1840. Legend has it that Oscar Wilde once enjoyed whiling away summer days at the elegant Bagno Elena.
sources.shortName: 6 of the best beaches in Naples

sources.snippet: In the amazing location of Posillipo, there is Bagno Elena, one of the most popular among locals. Posillipo if you don‚Äôt know, is one of the poshest areas of Naples; rich houses and amazing villas are built up to the hill that looks at the Gulf. Bagno Elena is really crowded during summer and is becoming popular among tourists as well because of Palazzo Donna Anna, an awesome landmark of Naples that you have to don‚Äôt miss in your visit.
sources.shortName: Exploring The 13 Best Beaches In Naples Italy; A Local Guide

sources.snippet: It is another traditional destination for Neapolitan bathers: Lido Sirena and Bagno Elena, in fact, are two historic bathing establishments located on the Posillipo coast. In addition to being very famous and appreciated, they are also equipped with excellent services that allow you to guarantee the relaxation of swimmers, such as Wi-fi, walkways-solarium and excellent catering.
sources.shortName: The 10 most beautiful beaches near Napoli

sources.snippet: Already famous back in 1840, Bagno Elena became even more famous because celebrities such as Oscar Wilde, Tot√≤, Richard Wagner, and Eduardo De Filippo used to spend their time here. Indeed, this is still today an elegant and exclusive area. Bagno Elena is located on a volcanic beach between the Palazzo Donn‚ÄôAnna and the Palazzo Guercia.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches In Naples and surroundings

sources.snippet: This is one of the more popular beaches in Naples, it can get very crowded so it‚Äôs best to plan to get there earlier in the day. Bagno Elena is a private beach, with sunbeds and umbrellas spread out along the long stretch of sand. There is only one caf√© on the beach which is known for being on the expensive side.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches In Naples, Italy [Napoli]

sources.snippet: The Bagno Elena is a Naples beach with the most history backing it up. Any Naples Italy beaches reviews you find will tell you about the beauty of this historical beach. It‚Äôs located in Posillipo, a town that offers some of the most stunning beaches around Naples as well as century-old architecture.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches Around Naples, Italy

sources.snippet: Il Bagno Elena is a raised pier and supported by wooden stilts where there is a private solarium. The beach was created to accommodate families with children and is organized to offer two different refreshment points, the beach bar and the deck bar.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Naples and its province, how to get there and book
Best Beaches in Naples not to be missed in 2024

places.name: Bagno Elena

reviews.text: Great beach club vibe with clean and well managed facilities. Staff are friendly and helpful.  It's a lot cleaner than I had expected. Paid 10 euros for 2pm till 5.30pm.  The 140 bus was full on way home, so just got a taxi for 10 euro back to Naples.

Great place for a beach day in Napoli. Visited a lot of places around the water, this was the only clean place we found. Food options are great, service is excellent. Worth the price! (‚Ç¨42 for 2 sunbeds & Umbrella)

The beach isn't very large, but there is enough space for everyone. Keep in mind that you have to pay to enter here. There is a lifeguard, which keeps an eye on everything. The cool thing is that you can buy a ticket in the morning and return here in the afternoon without paying extra cost.

sources.snippet: Marechiaro seaside town is famous and beloved because of its beauty, it is considered the most magical coastal place in the Posillipo area. The Italian word ‚ÄúScoglione‚Äù can be translated to ‚Äúbig cliff‚Äù and it is a common term in this area. The Scoglione di Marechiaro can be easily reached by boat thanks to the local boatmen who dock at Calata Ponticello, where the water is crystal clear, the view is wonderful, and the experience is unique.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches In Naples and surroundings

sources.snippet: One of the best free beaches in Naples Italy, Scoglione di Marechiaro is one of the most suggestive places to swim. It is a rock where people can settle down with a towel or rent a cot from the kiosks in the area. Admission is free, however, the number of spaces is limited.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches Around Naples, Italy

sources.snippet: This Napoli beach is known for its crystal clear, calm waters, making it one of the best beaches in Naples for swimming. Scoglione Di Marechiaro is entirely free, but they do have a limit on how many people they admit in a day, so try to get there early to secure a spot!
sources.shortName: 13 Best Beaches In Naples, Italy [Napoli]

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Reachable in summer with a boat ride at a cost of ‚Ç¨5 (return), beautiful location and sea with a view of Vesuvius, there is
possibility of renting sunbeds (‚Ç¨5), but you can also feel great just lying down with a simple towel on the tufaceous coast. I recommend arriving early in the morning due to large crowds in high season and weekends.

(Original)
Raggiungibile in estate con passaggio in barca al costo di 5‚Ç¨ (andata+ritorno), posto e mare stupendi con vista Vesuvio, c'√® la
possibilit√† di fittare lettini (5‚Ç¨), ma si sta benissimo anche stendendosi con semplice asciugamano sulla costa tufacea. Consiglio di arrivare presto al mattino causa grande affluenza in alta stagione e weekend.

(Translated by Google) Beautiful, semi-hidden beach, you have to go under the dock to access it. You have to be careful about cuts and scrapes because so many rocks

all in the hands of squatters obviously, but at least they make the beach accessible... the thriving municipality of Naples evidently doesn't care

places.generalDescription: Bagno Sirena is a hidden gem recommended by locals, offering a deck and sandy beach view at an affordable price. Accessible via a tunnel from the opposite side of the coast, it provides a great spot next to the free public beach. The amenities include reasonably priced sun chairs and umbrellas, a bar, changing rooms, and toilets.

sources.snippet: Steps away from Bagno Elena, on the other side of Palazzo Donn'Anna, Bagno Sirena is a smaller beach where you can relax on comfortable sunbeds and swim in the crystal clear sea minus the maddening crowds. Both Bagno Elena and Bagno Sirena boast incredible views of Mt Vesuvius in the distance. The main draw is the beachside restaurant, where you can enjoy top-notch Neapolitan cuisine: try the house speciality, impepate di cozze, fresh mussels prepared with tomatoes and white wine.
sources.shortName: 6 of the best beaches in Naples
Best Beaches in Naples not to be missed in 2024

places.name: Bagno Sirena Posillipo

reviews.text: The sea is not that deep. They have a private beach and public one all in the same place. There are opening and closing hours so you better check it. It is very clean. You also should try kayaking!

First beach we visited on our trip to Napoli, bit far from city center, but very nice place to visit. Thanks to google review we found out that the entance in on the other side of the road, in between doors and through the tunnel.
There are private and public parts of the beach, private one needs reservation, we used public one and rented umbrella from the private beach landlord. Water is bit dirty in the corner, but if you go far - gets nicer. There is Kayak rentals too, and beach closes at 5:30 pm

Entrance to the beach is in on the opposite side of the sea. You go down the stair and get into two beaches-private and public. We used to go to the public, as it was not so crowded. No shower, no changing room. Buy after midday you get natural shadow from the buildings and can enjoy open sea, when you pass the rocks.
Nice place for seabath....
Top
Old

places.generalDescription: Scoglione Marechiaro is a stunning and protected area that offers an amazing sea experience. While it may not be immediately accessible, the effort to reach it is well worth it. Visitors can take a wooden boat to access the beautiful semi-isolated beach on the cliff, where they can rent umbrellas and deck chairs at reasonable prices. The crystal-clear water allows for great visibility of fish, making it perfect for snorkeling.

sources.snippet: The Scaglione di Marechiaro (Marechiaro Cliffs) isn't a full-service beach, but it's one of the best spots to swim in the sea in Naples. The volcanic rock beach, located just off the coast in the Posillipo neighborhood, can only be reached by boat, with boats departing round the clock from the Marechiaro Port. Significantly less crowded than other nearby famous beaches, this is a beach for swimmers that crave crystalline waters.
sources.shortName: 6 of the best beaches in Naples

sources.snippet: For the Neapolitan people, this is the place where the water is the cleanest. Translating Marechiaro means clear water. Really here, the Gulf of Naples is clear blue and crystalline.
sources.shortName: Exploring The 13 Best Beaches In Naples Italy; A Local Guide
The 10 most beautiful beaches near Napoli

places.name: Scoglione Marechiaro

reviews.text: Authentic experience, not very crowded and not so touristic
Top

(Translated by Google) The only place where you can freshen up is to swim in the center of Naples because there are no beaches here. The nearest beach is 40 minutes away.
